Menkeu: Ekspor Masih Berat, Ekonomi Tumbuh 5,05 Persen
01 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Magdalena


Menkeu: Ekspor Masih Berat, Ekonomi Tumbuh 5,05 Persen

KBRN, Jakarta :  Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengatakan,  pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia pada kuartal ke-3 tahun 2019 masih di kisaran 5,05 persen. Perkiraan itu mengacu pada sejumlah faktor yang menjadi penopang pertumbuhan ekonomi seperti investasi dan konsumsi.
“Kita berharap konsumsi akan bertahan di atas 5 persen. Meski investasi mengalami perlambatan, tapi kita berharap investasi tetap terjaga di atas 5 persen,” kata Menkeu di Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Namun ada faktor penopang pertumbuhan ekonomi, yang menurut Sri Mulyani masih sulit untuk dikejar karena masih tingginya tekanan global.
“Yang berat memang kondisi eksternalnya. Ekspor, meskipun kemarin sudah menunjukkan perbaikan, masih menghadapi tantangan,” ujar Sri Mulyani.
Proyeksi pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia sebesar 5,05 persen pada kuartal ke-3 ini, menunjukkan pergerakan ekonomi Indonesia yang belum menggeliat, karena proyeksi pertumbuhan itu sama dengan pertumbuhan ekonomi di kuartal ke-2 sebesar 5,05 persen.
Kinerja ekspor hingga bulan September 2019 memang kurang menggembirakan.  Berdasarkan data Badan Pusat Statistik, ekspor Indonesia pada bulan September menurun sebesar 1,29 persen dibandingkan bulan sebelumnya, dan menurun sebesar 5,74 persen dibandingkan bulan yang sama tahun 2018.
Tekanan ekonomi global berupa perang dagang AS-Cina yang masih berlanjut, serta menurunnya harga sejumlah komoditas di pasar global, menjadi pemicu turunnya kinerja ekspor Indonesia di bulan September kemarin.

Minister of Finance: Exports Still Heavy, Economy Grows 5.05 Percent
01 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Magdalena


Minister of Finance: Exports Still Heavy, Economy Grows 5.05 Percent

KBRN, Jakarta: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said Indonesia's economic growth in the 3rd quarter of 2019 was still in the range of 5.05 percent. The estimate refers to a number of factors that underpin economic growth such as investment and consumption.
"We hope consumption will survive above 5 percent. Even though investment has slowed down, we hope that investment will be maintained above 5 percent, "said the Minister of Finance in Jakarta, Friday (1/11/2019).
But there are factors supporting economic growth, which according to Sri Mulyani is still difficult to pursue because of the high global pressure.
"The hard thing is the external conditions. Exports, although it has shown improvement yesterday, still face challenges, "said Sri Mulyani.
The projection of Indonesia's economic growth of 5.05 percent in the third quarter, shows the movement of the Indonesian economy that has not been stretched, because the growth projection is the same as economic growth in the second quarter of 5.05 percent.
The export performance up to September 2019 was not very encouraging. Based on data from the Central Statistics Agency, Indonesia's exports in September decreased by 1.29 percent compared to the previous month, and decreased by 5.74 percent compared to the same month in 2018.
Global economic pressures in the form of the continuing US-China trade war, and the decline in prices of a number of commodities in the global market, triggered the decline in Indonesia's export performance in September.
